Description:

The method getMonitors is not reentrant if multiple user interface threads are used. The variable 'monitors' is static and could be set to null by an other thread while one thread still executes getMonitors. This will result in a NullPointerException. 

StackTrace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.monitorEnumProc(Display.java:2731)
	at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.EnumDisplayMonitors(Native Method)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.getMonitors(Display.java:1710)
More precisely: The variable 'monitors' is static and could be set to null by calling getMonitors from an other user interface thread.

Fixed > 20070418

It's no longer static.  Since there is an instance per Display, the null pointer should no longer happen.  Can you retest this code and let me know?  I don't have a failing test case here.
We use multiple displays and multiple user interface threads but this happens once in half a year. So I can not retest it, sorry. But a not static variable solves the problem.
